metadata.description: AlgoJects dynamic feedback schema. Master JSON for FormStructure stored in Coda.

modules.title: General Feedback
modules.description: Universal module shown to all users. Focus: navigation, clarity and basic UX.

questions.question: How easy was it to find and access the main page with all projects and statistics?
How easy was it to access a project's page and find its reviews?
How easy was it to access user profile pages?
Did you feel the navigation was continuous across columns (main → project → profile) or more like separate page changes?
What would make the transition between navigation columns more fluid or intuitive for you?
Did you understand the content structure: Reviews contain Comments, and Comments contain Replies (no infinite rabbit holes)?
How clear and organized did you find this content structure?
How clearly did you understand the purpose of AlgoJects within the first minutes of use?
After browsing, how motivated did you feel to explore more projects on the platform?
Did anything confuse you or block you from using the platform optimally? (short answer)
Overall, how satisfied are you with navigation and structure?
Any additional general comments or suggestions?
How reliable or useful did you find the information (Reviews/Stats) for your investment decision?

modules.title: Contributor / Creator Feedback
modules.description: Shown to users who created project pages (contributors or project creators).

questions.question: How intuitive was the process to create and submit a new project page?
How useful did you find the 'notes' section (main body) to describe the project?
Were metadata fields (Website, Asset ID, Creator Wallet/Domain) clear to you?
How clear was the display of metadata on the project page after creation?
How easy was it to edit project metadata after creation?
Did you notice any delay in data display after saving it (propagation time)?
Did you feel the act of creating a project page was a valuable contribution to the ecosystem?
Any suggestions to improve the project creation/editing flow or metadata fields?

modules.title: Writer Feedback
modules.description: Shown to users who have written posts (Reviews, Comments, or Replies.)

questions.question: Did you already have an NFDomain, or did the platform guide you to create one before posting or liking a post?

options.label: I created one after platform guidance

questions.question: What is your rating of the publishing speed (wallet tx time + confirmation)?
Did you understand that the fee you paid on the post is intended for the AlgoJects protocol?
Did you understand the reward split for posts, comments, and replies and how they are distributed?
Overall, how would you rate the writing and posting experience?
Any feedback about your writing/posting experience (UX, costs, or the domain flow)?

modules.title: Curator Feedback
modules.description: Shown to users who performed curations (likes/endorsements). Includes perception about Curator Index and reward flows.

questions.question: When you give a 'like,' did you understand it triggers a transaction that sends ALGO directly to the author (not to the platform)?
Do you agree with this model where 'likes' send value directly to authors, with the platform receiving no fee?
How clear is the concept of the **Curator Index (CIX)**, which weights curator influence based on **predictiveness, diversity, and activity**?
Do you consider the CIX approach (Predictive Power + Diversity + Activity - Manipulation Penalty) fair?
Would you support the platform taking a small fee on each 'like' (e.g., 10%) to redistribute to top curators and for system sustainability?
Do you think a curator's influence should be reduced if they only curate a single project or very few authors?
Should curators who are inactive for a long period have reduced influence?
Any feedback about curation, CIX, or reward dynamics?

explainers.investor_mode: You can browse projects without connecting your wallet. To interact (post/like/create) you'll need to connect a wallet.
